input.infoText: The title of the song as it's displayed in-game and in menus. Note that this doesn't have to match the file name of the song or the chart.
The person or people who created the song. Will show up at the start of the song and in Freeplay.
The person or people who charted the song. If you're reading this, it's probably you.

textbutton.infoText: Every track in the song and it's properties. By default, this will be the instrumental and voices. The "Singer" controls whether a track is muted if a note is missed, and who has to miss the note for the track to be muted.

stepper.infoText: How many milliseconds the song should be offset to account for delay. A positive number means the song will play later relative to the chart, while a negative number means the song will play earlier.

textbutton.infoText: Moves the notes by however many milliseconds the offset is at, and set the offset to 0.

stepper.infoText: The speed of the song, in Beats Per Minute. Only affects the song on and after the beat specified below.
The speed at which the notes travel towards the strumline. A higher number means the notes will travel faster. Only affects the song on and after the beat specified below.

textbutton.infoText: Set the scroll speed to half of it's current value.
Set the scroll speed to double it's current value.

stepper.infoText: Which beat to change the BPM and Scroll Speed on.

textbutton.infoText: Set the "Change on Beat" value to zero.
Set the "Change on Beat" value to the beat the strumline is currently on.
The chart's difficulty ratings in the Freeplay menu.

stepper.infoText: Which beat to start the song on when previewing it in Freeplay.

textbutton.infoText: Set the "Preview Start" value to zero.
Set the "Preview Start" value to the beat the strumline is currently on.

stepper.infoText: Which beat to end the song on when previewing it in Freeplay.

textbutton.infoText: Set the "Preview End" value to the beat the strumline is currently on.

checkbox.infoText: Whether or not to skip the countdown at the start of the song.
Use a more compact chart format for a smaller file size. Uncheck this if you're making a chart meant to be played in another engine.

If unchecked, notes will be positioned purely on their time in the song. If checked, notes will be positioned based on what beat they fall on. This also means that the scroll speed will increase and decrease with BPM.

textbutton.infoText: All characters that appear on the stage and their note types. "Note Types" refers to a comma-separated list of types that, if a note is this type, will cause the associated character to sing it.

dropdown.infoText: The stage that the song takes place on.

textbutton.infoText: The types of noteskin that the notes should use, divided by strumline.

dropdown.infoText: The skin that the countdown and rating/combo popups should use.
The music that plays in the pause menu.
The music that plays in the game over screen.
The music that plays when restarting the song in the game over screen.
The music that plays in the results screen.

input.infoText: The file where certain song properties that are shared between charts of different difficulties are saved. Leave this blank if you do not wish to have any properties shared between chart difficulties.
The file where events are read from. Events can not be saved in chart files themselves, so if this file is not saved, the song will have no events.

checkbox.infoText: Whether or not to use the base Friday Night Funkin system for section camera characters. It's recommended to uncheck this if the chart's strumlines have different numbers of notes.

If checked, when a section's default note type changes who is singing (for example, gfSing) and that section's camera focus character is the one who would normally sing, the camera will instead focus on the note type's singer.

textbutton.infoText: The names of the chart's sides/strumlines as they're shown in the Freeplay Sandbox.

stepper.infoText: Which character the camera should focus on in this section. By default, 1 is Boyfriend and 2 is the opponent.

togglebutton.infoText: Make the camera focus on the opponent in this section.
Make the camera focus on Girlfriend in this section.
Make the camera focus on Boyfriend in this section.

stepper.infoText: How long (in steps) this section should be.

textbutton.infoText: Split the current section at the position of the strumline, creating two new identical but shorter sections.

stepper.infoText: How many sections earlier to copy notes from. A negative value will mean that notes from later sections are copied.

textbutton.infoText: Copy every note on the left side of another section into this section.
Copy every note on the right side of another section into this section.
Copy every note in another section into this section.

checkbox.infoText: If this is not checked, and the "Camera Character" of the section being copied from doesn't match the current section, the left and right sides of the copied notes will be swapped.

textbutton.infoText: Swap the notes on the left and right sides of the current section.
Flip the notes of the current section to their opposites. (Left becomes right, up becomes down, etc.)
Delete every note on the left side of the section.
Delete every note on the right side of the section.
Delete every note in the section.
Remove the current section entirely, getting rid of every note in it and moving every section after it earlier in the chart.

button.infoText: Select the previous event in the song.
Select the next event in the song.

textbutton.infoText: Select an event in the song from a list.
Teleport the strumline to the currently selected event's position in the song.
Move the selected event's position to the current position of the strumline.
Delete the selected event.

dropdown.infoText: The type of the new event to create, or the currently selected event.

textbutton.infoText: Create a new event with the currently selected type and the properties below.
Teleport the strumline to the earliest selected event's position in the song.
Teleport the strumline to the latest selected event's position in the song.
Duplicate every selected event. The earliest new event will be at the current position of the strumline.
Move every selected event's position such that the earliest event is at the current position of the strumline.
Delete every selected event.

input.infoText: The default note type that new notes will be assigned when created. This is also used when replacing all notes of one type with another note type, and when changing the note type of all selected notes.

dropdown.infoText: Select a note type from this list to automatically put it in the above box.
The note type to be affected by the two operations below.

textbutton.infoText: Select every note of the type specified above.
Delete every note of the type specified above.
Replace every note of the type specified above with the specified "Type of new Notes".
Change every section so that if every note on a certain side of the section is the same type, that type becomes the default note type for that side of the section.
Change the notes of every section affected by the section's default note type to have that note type, and get rid of all default note types for every section.
Move every note on and past the strumline's position later in the chart by the amount of beats specified above.
Move every note on and past the strumline's position earlier in the chart by the amount of beats specified above.

Glue together every adjacent section in the chart with the same camera character and default note types, decreasing the file size of the chart while effectively maintaining all the section properties.

stepper.infoText: Change every section in the chart to point the camera at this character.

textbutton.infoText: Change every section in the chart to point the camera at this character.
Copy the section lengths and camera characters from another chart file.
